Package org.ddolib.examples.talentscheduling

Class TSProblem

java.lang.Object
org.ddolib.examples.talentscheduling.TSProblem
All Implemented Interfaces:
Problem<TSState>
public class TSProblem extends Object implements Problem<TSState>
Class to model the Talent scheduling problem.

  • Field Details

    • optimal

      public final Optional<Double> optimal

  • Constructor Details

    • TSProblem

      public TSProblem(int nbScene, int nbActors, int[] costs, int[] duration, BitSet[] actors, Optional<Double> optimal)
      Parameters:
      nbScene - The number of scenes in the instance.
      nbActors - The number of actors in the problem.
      costs - For each actor i, gives its cost.
      duration - For each scene i, gives its duration.
      actors - For each scene, returns the set of actors needed
      optimal - The value of the optimal solution if known.

    • TSProblem

      public TSProblem(String fname) throws IOException
      Read data file following the format of https://people.eng.unimelb.edu.au/pstuckey/talent/
      Parameters:
      fname - The name of the file.
      Throws:
      IOException - If something goes wrong while reading input file.

  • Method Details

    • optimalValue

      public Optional<Double> optimalValue()
      Description copied from interface: Problem
      Returns the expected optimal value if known.

      WARNING: It must return the expected value returned by the solver. Be cautious if you are working with a minimization problem and negative number.

      Specified by:
      optimalValue in interface Problem<TSState>
      Returns:
      the expected optimal value if known.

      Specified by:
      domain in interface Problem<TSState>

    • onLocationActors

      public BitSet onLocationActors(TSState state)
      Given a state, returns which actors are already in location, i.e. actors needed for past scenes and needed for future scenes.
      Parameters:
      state - A state of the mdd.
      Returns:
      Which actors are currently on location.
